description: Enterprise techniques used by SoreFang, ATT&CK software S0516 (v1.0)
name: SoreFang (S0516)

techniques.comment: [SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can collect usernames from the local system via net.exe user.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can enumerate domain accounts via net.exe user /domain.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can use HTTP in C2 communications.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)(Citation: NCSC APT29 July 2020)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can decode and decrypt exfiltrated data sent to C2.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)

[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can gain access by exploiting a Sangfor SSL VPN vulnerability that allows for the placement and delivery of malicious update binaries.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) has the ability to list directories.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can download additional payloads from C2.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)(Citation: NCSC APT29 July 2020)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) has the ability to encode and RC6 encrypt data sent to C2.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can enumerate domain groups by executing net.exe group /domain.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can enumerate processes on a victim machine through use of [Tasklist](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0057).(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can gain persistence through use of scheduled tasks.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)

[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can collect the hostname, operating system configuration, product ID, and disk space on victim machines by executing [Systeminfo](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0096).(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)

[SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) can collect the TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and network adapter configuration on a compromised host via ipconfig.exe /all.(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
